comment.author: 66311327@N05
comment._content: "Frank Buchanan (June 14, 1862 – April 18, 1930) was a Democratic member of the United States House of Representatives from Illinois. He served in Congress for three terms from March 4, 1911 to March 3, 1917" en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Frank_Buchanan_%28Illinois_politici...

comment.author: 76016463@N00
comment._content: Buchanan had been indicted in New York in late December, 1915 with 7 others for allegedly plotting to stop munitions from going to the Allies. select.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=F40612FE3B5B1773... Among his co-defendants was David Lamar, who was convicted. The jury could not unanimously decide Buchanan's guilt, and it hung as to him and 4 others. I can't find a record that they were re-tried.
